Exercise Challenge

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post

‎03-27-2010 04:17 AM

brenda8859 (3/25/2010)
Gotta share my experience at the gym on Tuesday. There's this 50-ish man who exercises there, dyed black hair, he struts around like a proud rooster. He has legs that look like hams hanging from his body (very muscled legs) and he has that "look at me chicks, I'm THE man" look!!! Well,,,,short story long, this geezer (who knows how old he really is?) was "eyeing" me and watching me on the machines. He struts over and asks me how I was doing today. I said well, I'm getting pretty tired, I just lifted about 5 tons of weight at this point. He asked me if he could show me how to use some equipment. ROFLMAO ! I said well hubby is here, he's pretty up to date on the machines. He strutted away like he had been wounded. I'm telling you, ya gotta watch out sometimes, this geezer tried to pick up his "mother". SAD, but so funny at the same time. That was the second time he has approached me and wanted to talk. Should I be flattered or tell him to make an appt. with an opthalmologist???? Well that's my laugh for you all tonight! Brenda/MOM


Brenda . . . YOU GO GIRL!!!! You've STILL GOT IT!

Or, should I say "Couger!"????

GROWLLLL!

Report Inappropriate Content

‎03-27-2010 05:20 AM

runningbuffalo (3/26/2010)
brenda8859 (3/25/2010)
Gotta share my experience at the gym on Tuesday. There's this 50-ish man who exercises there, dyed black hair, he struts around like a proud rooster. He has legs that look like hams hanging from his body (very muscled legs) and he has that "look at me chicks, I'm THE man" look!!! Well,,,,short story long, this geezer (who knows how old he really is?) was "eyeing" me and watching me on the machines. He struts over and asks me how I was doing today. I said well, I'm getting pretty tired, I just lifted about 5 tons of weight at this point. He asked me if he could show me how to use some equipment. ROFLMAO ! I said well hubby is here, he's pretty up to date on the machines. He strutted away like he had been wounded. I'm telling you, ya gotta watch out sometimes, this geezer tried to pick up his "mother". SAD, but so funny at the same time. That was the second time he has approached me and wanted to talk. Should I be flattered or tell him to make an appt. with an opthalmologist???? Well that's my laugh for you all tonight! Brenda/MOM


Brenda . . . YOU GO GIRL!!!! You've STILL GOT IT!

Or, should I say "Couger!"????

GROWLLLL!



RB, I'm very proud of you for going to that pool !!! I too am nearly 100 lbs over what I'd like to weigh. I still can't get into a swimsuit. I just can't do it. We go to the beach usually twice a year and I just don't go there with a suit!!! I'll walk the beach in the evening, but in longer shorts and 3/4 length sleeves. But you did it, HOORAH for you.

Cougar, I'm not, like I said that poor old geezer was desperate for female companionship I think. I wanted to send him to Cindy's mom's house and help her with her weed whacker, but not sure she's interested either. LOL

We didn't get to the gym today. My fibro was killing me yesterday evening and today; so we went shopping instead. LOL I did a lot of walking around, and Rick parks in the south 40 so I can get that exercise in. What bothers me is standing still in line to pay. When I stop it hurts worse. Picked up some good fish I'd never heard of before at Sam's. Swami, I think it was called. Odd name, but they had demos and it tastes delicious. Very moist and mild tasting. I know you eat lots of fish, have you tried it? If not, look for it.

Once again, so proud of you for going to the pool and exercising. Keep it up. HUGS, Brenda
"Life is a classroom.  We are both student and teacher.  Each day  is a test and each day we receive a passing or failing grade in one particular subject:  GRACE".

‎03-27-2010 06:21 AM

Yay RB.........I'm glad you came out of your shell....teeeheee!!! I have to tell you that I have skinny friends that don't have the confidence to wear a bathing suit .....so....You Go Girl !!! And.....I even wear shorts with my suit too !!! And if I'm in the ocean...I wear a FULL WETSUIT ! So there Chica.....you done good. Now...I want to hear about the next time you go too.
I worked my fingers to the bone today making snickerdoodles and chocolate chip cookies for the Varisty Volley ball team.....and I did have one of each but I worked it off by riding my stationary bike for 30 minutes. I also did my tai bo Dvd for 35 minutes. My grandson and I walked for 30 minutes after lunch and I skateboarded with him for awhile. We just got back from dinner at my favorite mexican restaurant ...I had the chicken tostada with the beans on the side....yummmmy ! Now I am off to ride my stationary bike for 20 or so minutes. I hope this finds everyone doing well....See ya.......Big Red......Peace
Granny Red is Big Red Type 2 DX 2/17/09 A1c 7.7 2/2011 A1c 4.7  5/2011 A1c  4.7 8/2011 A1c 4.9 -11/2011 -4.7
March / 2012 New A1c 5.0 !
A1c Nov.2012...4.7
A1c Jan 21, 2013 5.2 Adding Met 2 X 500 mg
Newest A1c April 24,2013....back to 4.9......WOOOOOHOOOO!!!!
Low Carb and lots of Exercise Don't believe everything you think !!!!!! Please help save the Earth.....it's the only planet with Chocolate !!!!
NATIVE EARTH !!!!!
My Secret..............low carb, exercise, Graze not Gorge and portion size !!!!!!

Information is not knowledge; knowledge is not wisdom; wisdom is not truth. Truth must be absolute; otherwise it is merely opinion.

RB, I'm very proud of you for going to that pool !!! I too am nearly 100 lbs over what I'd like to weigh. I still can't get into a swimsuit. I just can't do it. We go to the beach usually twice a year and I just don't go there with a suit!!! I'll walk the beach in the evening, but in longer shorts and 3/4 length sleeves. But you did it, HOORAH for you.

We didn't get to the gym today. My fibro was killing me yesterday evening and today; so we went shopping instead. LOL I did a lot of walking around, and Rick parks in the south 40 so I can get that exercise in.

Brenda, I'm so sorry to hear your fibro is so bad. I can't imagine . . . that has to miserable! I hope this fibro flair up gets better soon! {{Hugs}}


What bothers me is standing still in line to pay. When I stop it hurts worse. Picked up some good fish I'd never heard of before at Sam's. Swami, I think it was called. Odd name, but they had demos and it tastes delicious. Very moist and mild tasting. I know you eat lots of fish, have you tried it? If not, look for it.


Brenda, I never heard of Swami! Thanks for the head's up! How did you cook it? Yes . . . I will check around and buy some!

Once again, so proud of you for going to the pool and exercising. Keep it up. HUGS, Brenda


Thanks again, Brenda . . . I mean it when I say you, Ang, Julia, Shelly, Jeanie, Nancy, Dianne, Morris, Alan, Lizzy, etc. . . . are such sources of support and motivation to me! Appreciate all you do!



Hope you have a great day tomorrow!



Hugs,



RB

Now girl . . . you have great legs . . .. what are YOU doing covering them up??? Size 6 /8 . . . you've worked HARD to achieve your success . . . enjoy your new body! If you wanna just wear your bathing suit . . . do so!

I worked my fingers to the bone today making snickerdoodles and chocolate chip cookies for the Varisty Volley ball team.....and I did have one of each but I worked it off by riding my stationary bike for 30 minutes. I also did my tai bo Dvd for 35 minutes. My grandson and I walked for 30 minutes after lunch and I skateboarded with him for awhile. Sheesh! You have been a busy, busy girl today! Gotta tell you - I could not handle making chocolate chip cookies . . . I'd be heading to the couch w/ cookie dough and a movie. LOL . . . I'm sure your snickerdoodles & chocolate chip cookies were/are great!

Tai Bo - Billy Blanks - Now I'm impressed! That's a serious work out! You go girl!!
Little Ashton is very lucky to have such a cool Granny! Skateboarding, surfing, catering, gardening, . . . multiple talents!

Well, I'm off to get some sleep.

Thanks again for your support!

Ciao,

RB

‎03-27-2010 09:11 AM

Today's exercise was two miles walking this evening,and I had to force myself to do it.Glad I got up,and did it tho,as I feel energized again.I babysat all day guess thats was why,I was so tired feeling.

Brenda: My mom can run that weed whacker,so don't send the gym dude over.LOL! My son showed her how to use it today as he was doing yard work for her.

Great job with the exercise everybody!

RB: Glad to hear you took the plunge,got the swimsuit on,and got in the pool.Yay!!! I hope you find the pool easier on your feet and joints.

Have a great weekend everyone!

Wishing everyone a great evening!

‎03-28-2010 12:20 AM

Went swimming for 1 hr and 45 minutes today! {It's not a pattern yet . .. but it's day two of a new start! }

I showed up at 1300 and hardly anyone was there . . . then . . . visualize the Caddy Swim Day in Caddy Shack . . . apparently they have birthday swim parties there! There were a ton of people there today! LOL I bobbed up and down, dog paddled, back stroked, and just played in the water . . . had a lot of fun. (The Lazy River was so packed - I thought to myself "this is what spawning salmon must feel like!" LOL . . . Of course, we were going with the current, the salmon go against it. Anyway - I had fun again today. )

I'm going to have to buy swim shoes & a hair cover. Getting my roots done next Friday. Plus the gunite is a little rough on tender feet . . .

Btw, it's amazing in just these first two days . . . my sugars already showing improvement!

Well, I better scoot. Thanks for everyone's support!

Now, I want to hear from YOU guys! How is your day going??

RB

‎03-28-2010 12:48 AM

Hi Everyone......It is 81 degrees at my house today so I layed out in the sun for awhile with only #15 sunscreen........Yes...I'm living dangerously but I want to start wearing shorts and I can't buy everyone in our town sunglasses so they won't be blinded by my white legs......LOL
I did some weeding and I rode my stationary bike two times for 15 minutes each. I also walked up and down my driveway 5 times( that equals a mile and a 10th). I hope everyone is getting out there and doing something.
RB....I am so very proud of you.....keep up the good work.
Cindy......Wanna babysit for me too ???....teeeheee!!! Great job on the walking. My hubby wants to start walking and so we may start a morning time walk( he works nights)....at least I hope he does....he has been doing his weights but needs to step it up a bit.
See ya.......Big Red..............Peace
Granny Red is Big Red Type 2 DX 2/17/09 A1c 7.7 2/2011 A1c 4.7  5/2011 A1c  4.7 8/2011 A1c 4.9 -11/2011 -4.7
March / 2012 New A1c 5.0 !
A1c Nov.2012...4.7
A1c Jan 21, 2013 5.2 Adding Met 2 X 500 mg
Newest A1c April 24,2013....back to 4.9......WOOOOOHOOOO!!!!

‎03-28-2010 12:50 AM

runningbuffalo (3/27/2010)
Went swimming for 1 hr and 45 minutes today! {It's not a pattern yet . .. but it's day two of a new start! }
I showed up at 1300 and hardly anyone was there . . . then . . . visualize the Caddy Swim Day in Caddy Shack . . . apparently they have birthday swim parties there! There were a ton of people there today! LOL I bobbed up and down, dog paddled, back stroked, and just played in the water . . . had a lot of fun. (The Lazy River was so packed - I thought to myself "this is what spawning salmon must feel like!" LOL . . . Of course, we were going with the current, the salmon go against it. Anyway - I had fun again today. )
I'm going to have to buy swim shoes & a hair cover. Getting my roots done next Friday. Plus the gunite is a little rough on tender feet . . .
Btw, it's amazing in just these first two days . . . my sugars already showing improvement!
Well, I better scoot. Thanks for everyone's support!
Now, I want to hear from YOU guys! How is your day going??

Hey, RB!!! I am so glad to see you back here and back exercising! Looks like you're off to a great start! Always knew you were cool, and now you'll be even cooler in the pool! ; )Now, I'm going to have to go back and watch Caddy Shackagain! Thanks to you, I received an iPod from SantaHubby for Christmas. I have put all my favorite music videos on it that rock at my 3.5 mph walking speed, and connected it to the TV. (The ones that are a little slower, I use for the elliptical or the bike that I have on a trainer.) It's so hard to tear myself away from my iPod, I hardly know what's going on in the news world, anymore. LOL Well, looking forward to hearing more from you, and from the inspiring Julia and Mike, as well. Great job, everybody!
Nancy ~ T2 since '98 ~ 17 yrs ~ D&E 11yrs ~ treadmill, elliptical, bike 15-20 minutes 2-3x/day (includes evenings), dumbbells/strength-training, small portions heart-healthy high-fiber/low-fat fuel/carb-counting, modified Mediterranean/semi-vegetarian plant-based diet; 500mg Glucophage XR x4, 5mg Glipizide ER x4, 4000IU Vit. D/day ~ RHR 55 ~ Between 5.9-6.9 A1cs, av. 6.5
